'''Ethical issues''' e.g. animal testing, fairtrade, child labour organic food etc. etc. can actually kill may people. Fairtrade: 1669 a farmer complained about not getting enough money, he was shot dead the next day. Animal testing 2003 activist group complained against shampoo for animal testing, within a month their meeting point was blown up with c4 they all died but two who died in hospital. Child laobour: Katherine McDermott complained against an African company that make cement for using children to help make it. She was poisoned within 3 months.

'''Ethics''', sometimes known as '''moral philosophy''', is a branch of [[philosophy]] that involves systematizing, defending and recommending concepts of right and wrong [[action (philosophy)|conduct]].<ref name="iep.utm.edu">''Internet Encyclopedia of Philosophy'': [http://www.iep.utm.edu/ethics/ "Ethics"]</ref> The term comes from the [[Ancient Greek|Greek]] word ἠθικός ''ethikos'' from ἦθος ''[[ethos]]'', which means "custom, [[habit]]". The superfield within philosophy known as [[axiology]] includes both ethics and [[aesthetics]] and is unified by each sub-branch's concern with value.<ref>''[[Random House Unabridged Dictionary]]'': [http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/axiology Entry on Axiology.]</ref> Philosophical ethics investigates what is the best way for humans to live, and what kinds of actions are right or wrong in particular circumstances.

  +   +   +   +
Ethics''', sometimes known as '''moral philosophy''', is a branch of [[philosophy]] that involves systematizing, defending and recommending concepts of right and wrong [[action (philosophy)|conduct]].<ref name="iep.utm.edu">''Internet Encyclopedia of Philosophy'': [http://www.iep.utm.edu/ethics/ "Ethics"]</ref> The term comes from the [[Ancient Greek|Greek]] word ἠθικός ''ethikos'' from ἦθος ''[[ethos]]'', which means "custom, [[habit]]". The superfield within philosophy known as [[axiology]] includes both ethics and [[aesthetics]] and is unified by each sub-branch's concern with value.<ref>''[[Random House Unabridged Dictionary]]'': [http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/axiology Entry on Axiology.]</ref> Philosophical ethics investigates what is the best way for humans to live, and what kinds of actions are right or wrong in particular circumstances.
 
Ethics may be divided into three major areas of study:<ref name="iep.utm.edu"/>
 
Ethics may be divided into three major areas of study:<ref name="iep.utm.edu"/>
 
*[[Meta-ethics]], about the theoretical meaning and reference of moral propositions and how their [[truth value]]s (if any) may be determined
 
*[[Meta-ethics]], about the theoretical meaning and reference of moral propositions and how their [[truth value]]s (if any) may be determined
